CatDescriptText: N.D. Davis, 446 Morgan Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the recreational facilities for young people in Pittsburgh are adequate? If not, what do you think should be done about it?" answer reads: "No, I don't.  In fact, there is no place for the children to go and to play except in streets.  As far as teh costs, I think that there is plenty of tax money available.  There is a lot of money spent for redevelopment, so why not put some of that money in for the redevelopment of the youths."
TitMainTitle: Three men, one writing in notebook, including N.D. Davis wearing moustache, plaid shirt, and dark striped cap, standing in front of brick building with sign reading "sal...prep..our ice ..."
